tit.j: 川田神社 (甲賀市水口町)

sen.j: 川田神社（かわたじんじゃ）は、滋賀県甲賀市水口町に鎮座する神社である。
sen.e: Kawata-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine that exists in Minakuchi-cho, Koga City, Shiga Prefecture.
Kawata-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Minakuchi-cho, Koga City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: that existsをlocatedに変更しました。
sen.e: Kawata-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Minakuchi-cho, Koga City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 垂仁天皇の御宇に創祀されたと伝わる。
sen.e: It has been transmitted that the shrine was established in the reign of Emperor Suinin.
It is said that the shrine was established in the reign of Emperor Suinin.
sen.cmt: has been transmittedをis saidに変更しました。
sen.e: It is said that the shrine was established in the reign of Emperor Suinin.

sen.j: 延喜式に記載された名神大社である。
sen.e: It is a Myojin-taisha Shrine listed in Engishiki (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).
It is a Myojin-taisha Shrine listed in Engishiki (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).
It is a Myojin-taisha Shrine listed in Engishiki (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

sen.j: 享保11年には正一位の神階を受けた。
sen.e: The shrine was given a shinkai (ranks granted to shinto deity) of Shoichii (Senior First Rank) in 1726.
The shrine was given a shinkai (ranks granted to shinto deity) of Shoichii (Senior First Rank) in 1726.
The shrine was given a shinkai (ranks granted to shinto deity) of Shoichii (Senior First Rank) in 1726.
It is the soja (representative shrine in the area) of Kuratasho (Kurata area).
It is the soja (representative shrine in the area) of Kuratasho (Kurata area).
It is the soja (representative shrine in the area) of Kuratasho (Kurata area).

sen.j: 明治9年に村社、明治17年に郷社、昭和11年に県社に列した。
sen.e: It was listed as sonsha (village shrine) in 1876, gosha (village shrine) in 1884 and promoted to kensha (prefectural shrine) in 1936.
It was listed as a sonsha (a village shrine) in 1876, a gosha (a regional shrine) in 1884 and promoted to a kensha (a prefectural shrine) in 1936.
sen.cmt: 郷社をa regional shrineに変更しました。
sen.e: It was listed as a sonsha (a village shrine) in 1876, a gosha (a regional shrine) in 1884 and promoted to a kensha (a prefectural shrine) in 1936.

sen.cmt: 配祀神の説明を加えました。
「古式揚矢祭」の訳は推測です。
sen.e: Yoya Archery festival in ancient style
sen.cmt: 揚矢祭（ようやまつり）の名称を加えました。
sen.e: Yoya Archery festival in ancient style
